conrad.weiser.robinhood.api

Class ConfigurationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • conrad.weiser.robinhood.api.ConfigurationManager

  • public class ConfigurationManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Method which stores the current configuration for the library. The authentication key used for most of the other functions is stored here. Singleton is used so there can only be one instance of this running.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConfigurationManager()

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ConfigurationManager getInstance()
        Method which gets the current instance of the ConfigurationManager If one does not exist, it creates one and returns it

      • getToken

        public java.lang.String getToken()
                          throws RobinhoodNotLoggedInException
        Method which gets the saved authorization token if the user is logged in. If one does not exist, it throws an error reminding the user to run the login functions first.
        Returns:
        the saved Token for the logged in user
        Throws:
        RobinhoodNotLoggedInException - if there is no stored Token. This must be populated by the setToken() method first

      • setAuthToken

        public void setAuthToken(java.lang.String token)
        Method which registers the authToken for the user into the Configuration Manager
        Parameters:
        The - verified Authorization Token for the user

      • getRatelimit

        public long getRatelimit()
        Method returning the current ratelimit. By default, this is 500 milliseconds (.5 seconds)

      • setRatelimit

        public void setRatelimit(int newRateLimitValue)
        Set a new ratelimit (in milliseconds)

      • getAccountNumber

        public java.lang.String getAccountNumber()

      • setAccountNumber

        public void setAccountNumber(java.lang.String accountNumber)

      • getAccountUrl

        public java.lang.String getAccountUrl()
        Method returning the Account URL for the logged in user. This is created by appending the account number to a base URL. This is valid in most order requests
        Returns:
        the account URL
